intro: Zulatia, commonly known as the "flower of the desert," is a rare and resilient plant native to arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant has feathery leaves that help reduce water loss, adapting to extreme desert conditions. Zulatia thrives in well-drained soils and requires minimal water, making it a symbol of survival in harsh environments. Its unique appearance and ecological significance make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists alike.
